page.title: 18GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content:
The block is almost completely rural. There are parts of a number of small villages, but no settlement is completely contained in the block. Most of the area is covered by farmland. The farms are mixed farms. Around the village of Halkyn the scenery changes, as the land gets higher so it becomes more desolate, Halkyn is surrounded by moorland.
The main road to the North Wales coast, the A 55, cuts the block into two. It is very busy in the summer with tourists.
There are far more sheep than people in this block of land, and far more trees than houses as there are several small woods!
